result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Warren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
STATE OF WISCONSIN FOR UNPAID MONROE COUNTY RESTITUTION OWING AS FOLLOWS:

     CRIME VICTIM COMPENSATION, MADISON, WI - $21,784.03

PLUS A RESTITUTION SURCHARGE OWING TO MONROE COUNTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,269.83 AND COURT COSTS OF $518.00 FOR A TOTAL JUDGMENT OF $24,571.86.

(FOR FURTHER INFORMATION SEE MONROE COUNTY CASE 14CF39)

supervisions.notes:
**9/11/2014 - JOC corrected to include count 4 as dismissed & read in.

***9/16/2014 - JOC amended to reflect Defendant granted Huber/work release privileges.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and 10% surcharge in an amount to be determined.  State provide amount within 60 days of sentence.  Upon notification, defendant has 30 days to request a restitution hearing.  To be paid by wage assignment.

No contact with Joseph Raabe, Marc Hammond or their residences.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
***9/16/2014 - JOC amended to reflect Defendant granted Huber/work release privileges.

timeConds.notes: May be served in Juneau County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
